categories.title: ElizaOS Showcases New AI Agents and Tools

content.text: ElizaOS announced a showcase of six innovative AI agents and tools that are being built on their platform. The company shared details about these projects in a Twitter thread, highlighting real builds with practical applications.

The featured projects include: Steambot Willie by Tapestry_AI (an agent that scouts IP and suggests remixes), The Intern (a marketing agent for X), ProAgentAI (a yield optimizer for DeFi), Data Barista (timeline-native matchmaking), Soulmates (intent-based connection agent), and ElizaOS x Phala (secure agent running in a Trusted Execution Environment).
ElizaOS announced a demo event for these projects scheduled for 17:00 UTC, inviting users to see why these projects stand out and understand what agents are really capable of.
User @dankvr shared that they are creating ElizaOS agents for projects on @x23_ai, showing images of animated and rigged characters created using AI as a proof of concept.
Twitter user @shawmakesmagic shared a link to the 'Eliza Builder Demos' and engaged in various conversations about technology, NFTs, and development.

## CLI and Environment Improvements

The ElizaOS CLI has received several updates and fixes. The publish command has been refactored and enhanced (#4424), and an issue with incorrect version detection has been fixed to show the correct latest CLI version (#4435). Additionally, there was a hotfix for version installation issues (#4454). The CLI command documentation has also been updated (#4448).

Environment handling has been refactored (#4445) with added docstrings to the `refactor-env` functionality (#4446).

## Plugin System Updates

Several plugin-related issues have been addressed. A fix was implemented to make plugin.routes work correctly (#4415), and the plugin install command for plugins and start functionality has been fixed (#4456). The OpenAI plugin now emits model usage events for embeddings and image description (#4438). Additionally, the plugin-redpill has been removed from the monorepo (#4428).

## Documentation and Code Quality

Documentation has been improved with the addition of a blog for Twitter agent setup (#4425) and a fix for title spacing (#4443). The Thai README had a broken image path that has been updated (#4433). 

Code quality improvements include fixing ESM type generation in several packages including SQL, Bootstrap, and OpenAI (#4442), and organizing imports and using relative paths (#4447).

categories.title: Recent Pull Requests in the elizaOS/eliza Repository

content.text: Several pull requests have been submitted to the elizaOS/eliza repository recently. Developer wtfsayo contributed two maintenance PRs: PR #4445 for refactoring environment variable handling and PR #4448 for updating CLI command documentation. These changes likely improve code organization and user documentation.
Developer jmikedupont2 submitted PR #3911 for a feature related to local autodoc functionality (Feature/v2/autodoc local), which appears to be a significant feature addition to the project.
A new feature for polygon support was proposed by monilpat in PR #4449, adding geometric capabilities to the project.

Developer K1mc4n has been active in documentation, submitting multiple PRs (#4451, #4452, #4453) to create an Indonesian version of the README file (README_IND.md), followed by PR #4455 which makes improvements to the Indonesian documentation. These contributions enhance the project's accessibility to Indonesian-speaking users.

categories.title: Recent GitHub Issues in the elizaOS/eliza Repository

content.text:
Three issues have been recently reported in the elizaOS/eliza GitHub repository:

1. Issue #4181: Twitter interactions are being fetched but reactions have not been implemented yet. This issue was reported by user tcm390.

2. Issue #4180: Twitter space functionality is not working properly. This issue was also reported by user tcm390.

3. Issue #4457: There is a unicode escape error occurring in pglite log entries. This issue was reported by user plvo.

These issues highlight ongoing development challenges in the eliza project, particularly with Twitter integration and logging functionality.

The elizaos/eliza repository showed significant activity over a two-day period. From May 4-5, 2025, there were 5 new pull requests with 11 merged PRs and 11 active contributors working on the project. The following day (May 5-6, 2025) saw increased PR creation with 9 new pull requests, though fewer were merged (4). This second day also recorded 1 new issue being opened, with a slight decrease to 9 active contributors.
sources: From 2025-05-04 to 2025-05-05, elizaos/eliza had 5 new PRs (11 merged), 0 new issues, and 11 active contributors.
From 2025-05-05 to 2025-05-06, elizaos/eliza had 9 new PRs (4 merged), 1 new issues, and 9 active contributors.
